bib_record.title: Cross sections for the Li-6(p,He-3)He-4 reaction at energies between 0.1 and 3.0 MeV.

free_txt: Collimated Si surface-barrier detectors thick
enough to completely stop the reaction products; two
were mounted on movable arms within the chamber, while
a third fixed at a back angle, served as a monitor in
the angular distribution measurements.
Uncertainty in target thickness
Thin films of LiF enriched to
99.3% in 6Li, evaporated on 10 mu-g/cm**2 carbon foils
Errors from graphic bars and digitizing.
The graphic bars represent the relative
uncertainties which vary from about 10% at a few angles
at the lowest energies to about 2% at some higher
energies, and are typically 3-5%.
Fig. 3 from Phys.Rev.,C20(1979)1984
The error bars represent the relative
uncertainties which vary from about 10% at a few angles
at the lowest energies to about 2% at some higher
energies, and are typically 3-5%.
Figs. 4,5 from Phys.Rev.,C20(1979)1984
Statistical error
Table 1 from Phys.Rev.,C20(1979)1984
Relative error
Absolute uncertainty. The largest
contribution to this value arises from the estimated
error in the determination of the target thickness
(see ERR-1 in Subent 001).
Table 1 from Phys.Rev.,C20(1979)1984
